thread.title: The *new* Chewbacca just penned a touching tribute to the OG Chewbacca, Peter Mayhew
thread.title_full: The *new* Chewbacca just penned a touching tribute to the OG Chewbacca, Peter Mayhew

author: Heather Mason
title: The *new* Chewbacca just penned a touching tribute to the OG Chewbacca, Peter Mayhew
text:
The *new* Chewbacca just penned a touching tribute to the OG Chewbacca, Peter Mayhew There’s a new Chewbacca in town! Actor Joonas Suotamo will be playing Chewbacca in the upcoming Young Han Solo film and he made it a point to thank the original Chewbacca actor Peter Mayhew .
The actor posted a tribute on his Instagram account today after the first photo from the new Han Solo film hit the internet:
A post shared by Joonas Suotamo (@joonassuotamo) on Feb 21, 2017 at 9:35am PST 
How sweet! Joonas understands that Chewbacca is one of the most beloved Star Wars characters, so taking on the mantle from Peter Mayhew is a pretty big deal. Honestly, does anyone NOT love Chewbacca? After all, a hug from Chewbacca can solve all of the major world issues and warm the coldest of hearts — even mine:
A post shared by Heather Mason (@nerdheather) on Dec 27, 2015 at 7:59pm PST 
The upcoming Han Solo features younger versions of our favorite characters, with Alden Ehrenreich taking over as Han Solo and Donald Glover as Lando Calrissian, to name a couple. They look like they’re having a great time in the first photo from set. Chewie must be making them all laugh in this photo.
Han Solo - Smuggler. Scoundrel. Hero. A new Star Wars Story begins. https://t.co/6mjWKQcwwk pic.twitter.com/dWJwccpY33 
— Star Wars (@starwars) February 21, 2017 Joonas seems to be having a ball since he began playing Chewbacca in The Force Awakens . On Instagram , he posts pictures of him traveling to conventions and meeting fans and a few behind-the-scenes images from his time thus far in the Star Wars family.
A post shared by Joonas Suotamo (@joonassuotamo) on Dec 27, 2015 at 8:33am PST 
A post shared by Joonas Suotamo (@joonassuotamo) on Sep 25, 2016 at 6:42am PDT 
The still untitled Young Han Solo spin-off film will take place before A New Hope in canon so we’ll get to see what the crew was up to before Han met Luke and Leia. You can see the new Han Solo film in theaters May 25, 2018.
